Easy drinking but not thin or acerbic like some session IPAs; theres just the right amount of sweetness in the malt base. Hops are predominantly herbal with maybe a bit of pine. Now, 5.25% is pretty high for a session IPA, but its certainly among the best Ive had. Still, I wonder if the brewerys reputation isnt carrying it just a bit here to get into the 99th percentile overall on the site. Id be happy to drink this any time but it doesnt cross into the territory where Id work very hard to seek it out. 

tl;dr summary: About as good as a classic lower-ABV IPA is going to get.

Bottle shared. Lightly hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is hoppy, very citrusy, leafy, grapefruit/lemon aromas. Taste is hoppy, citrusy, nice bitterness. Palate is light bodied with good carbonation. A bit heavy for a session IPA I feel, but pretty good.

Tap at The Hopping Pig. Thick grassy nose, strained fruit, peach, tobacco. Smooth, piney initial, goes to overripe dates and peaches, then balances, with medium-strength bitter tracks. Thin-medium body. Pleasant and smooth.

Bottle from QFC. Lighter hop aroma. This is not an in your face Pine-Sol bomb. This has a lovely, light citrus aroma. The fresh hop aroma is quite refreshing. Great aroma. Light on the palate with a crisp, citrus hop bite. Fuck this is good. What else can eat said other than this hits the spot. I could drink quite a few of these. Great stuff.

Bottle shared during RBWG 2016 - picked up at AJs. Pours clear orange-gold with a creamy white head. Dry and pithy on the nose, with more citrus, pine needles, rind. Light sweet flavor with dry pale malts, bitter pine, orange rind, grass, some pithy grapefruit. Light bodied with average carbonation. Quite dry and pithy on the finish, pretty bitter, more citrus notes. Not bad. Just a bit too bitter, especially in the aftertaste.

Bottle shared at RBWG 2016. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. Clear golden yellow coloured pour with a fading fine white head. Aroma is caramel, pine and some dank hop. Flavour is composed of semi sweet base grains, caramel, bitter lemon, dank, pine, candied orange. Palate is sticky hop, moderate carbonation. Assertive nice clean bitterness.

Bottle at hotel lobby fart share @RBWG 2016. Almost clear golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, fresh hops, mango and light grain. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, light grain and mango. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

22 oz from my brother for my birthday. Drank this back in November. Poured a nice gold color with a white head. Aroma is all sorts of resinous hops, savory, herbal (mostly sage and mint), pine, mandarin, grapefruit, crackers, and some sweetness back there too (mango, peach). Taste is a big mouthful of hops. Sagey, piney resin up front with an oily med-high bitterness, oniony, then grapefruit, soft orange notes and light cracker and caramel. Oily, mouth-coating resin, impressive body for ~5%, nice smooth carbonation. While this may technically be considered a SIPA, and it packs an amazing density of hop flavor and aroma, the bitterness and intense "savory" profile do not exactly support the sessionability of this beer. Impressive but I wouldnt want more than one at a time, even in a 12 oz serving.

12 oz bottle. Aroma is piney, light perfume, earth, light floral. Pours hazy orange with a quickly collapsing bone-white head. Taste is highly bitter, very hoppy, alongside a light candy sweetness. Somewhat harsh carbonation, but when the flavors are this nice, it doesnt really bother me like it would in a lesser IPA. Good brew, but how can it be a session IPA at this strength?

Almost musty aroma, not very strong. Taste is bold, fresh and assertive. Hops are straight forward and a bit sharp. Notes of bread, grass, pine. Almost no sweetness. Tastes like spring water mixed with west coast strong hops and pine, but drinks easy. Pretty high IBU for a session. Very enjoyable on palate with lingering smoothness not apparent in rest of sip. Pretty badass.

12 oz bottle- Pours golden orange with a sappy white head that retains nicely leaving a thick blanket and cobwebby lace. Aroma is pungent, sappy, pine resin, some floral notes. The taste is very similar, first showing a medium bodied IPA, with all the deScriptors, but after a few drinks the thinness kind of shows through. Very good session IPA, could drink many.
Clear orange. Nose is very piney, grapefruit. Taste matches, lots of bitter grapefruit peel, pine, assertive, almost no sweetness.
Dark golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, pine, citrus. Taste of citrus, pine, toast, tropical fruits, resin, and grapefruit.

This is closer to a "regular" IPA than any other session IPA Ive tried. Medium dark golden color. Aroma - lost on my stuffed sinuses. Taste is very intense for a session - lots of pine and citrus rind hops flavor and bitterness, with a near-perfect malt balance. Heaviest palate of any other session Ive tried. It should go very well with food, given its strong hops flavor and bitterness. Very, very good.

Piney, grassy hop aroma from the bottle turning somewhat skunky in the glass in the very good way. Nice clear medium yellow with a foamy white head. Nice sharp bitter bite hits right away with more pine and grass. The body is thin but thats to be expected for this type of beer. The balance here is very good considering the strong hop component. Ends with a lasting bitterness on the tongue. Very good session IPA
Fantastic. Tons of hop flavor. Sessionable but fuller bodied than a lot of session ipas. Great aromatics.

Pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head. Mild grapefruit in the aroma, some sweetness, bitter citrus rind. Flavors were loaded with citrus hop flavor (grapefruit, lemon), some mango, and as with most of the Alpine IPAs, a nice biscuty/cracker malt backdrop to balance things out and provide that velvet mouthfeel. Super clean astringent finish. Easy to drink in large quantities.
On draft at Deep Ellum. Clear light golden pour with big hop aromas. Nice pine and citrus notes. Very flavorful and fresh tasting. Dig it.

22oz bottle. Hazy orange w/ off white head. Aroma of pine and grapefruit/citrus upfront w/ a honey sweet malt backbone & cereal. Flavor is tangerine citrus and resin w/ a dry resinous finish. Overall wonderfully aromatic w/ a touch of sweet malt on the backbone for balance.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a hazy, bright yellow-gold with a densely bubbly cream colored head. Aromas of citrus and pine with a hint of spice. Flavor much the same with some grapefruit, some noticeable malt notes, and a little mild, lingering bitterness. The flavors are stronger than expected and very well balanced. Smooth, medium mouth feel with some dense carbonation that almost gives it a textured feel. Overall, an excellent session IPA. Lots of flavor, and the flavors work together well. I might start keeping this on hand somewhat regularly.

Tap at Spring Street bar, LA. Pilsener pour. A: deep robust ipa, exotic fruit, lots of hops, lime, pine note. T: quite watery and bitter, some bitter fruitiness, nettle, lemon. Grass notes in aftertaste.

22 oz. bb 17 May 2016. Big juicy aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, orange, honey, toast and spruce. Taste leans drier with toast, resin, citrus zest, green herb and ash. Clear orange-amber body supports a loose but lasting film of bubbles. Light-medium body has medium carbonation. Nice balance, but has a long wooden-cardboard bitter that gets a little off-putting after a while.

Bottle - Best by June 10, 2016.
Appearance: Golden to amber hued body with a creamy off-white head. Firm coating after dissipation.
Aroma: Bright orange and pine, hop forward with a touch of malt sweetness.
Taste: Mild to moderately bitter, bitterness is orange pithy, orange is prominent. Very simple beer, malt base is out of the way. Clean finish with orange lingering.
Palate: Medium bodied, mild carb, though prickly enough to accent a slight spicy bitterness.
Overall: Not near worth the price of admission, but I had to try this once. Rather generic IPA.

Bottle. Pours out a nice golden color with a moderate white head. Aroma is of some nice floral, pine, citrus peel and light grassy hops, a touch of sweet grain notes and cracker. Taste is solid, a lot more full of a mouthful than the abv would indicate. Nice hoppy profile, grass, citrus peel, floral notes. Light pine. Really tasty.

Bomber. Pours a clear light golden in color. Minimal white head diminishes quickly to a thin film with some spotty lacing. Aromas of sweet malt and floral, fruity hops. Taste is pretty nice; with tons of citrus, some pine, and some pith. Fairly dry and bitter... Just the way I like it.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Rating #1568 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday Brew Tour Stop #3 - On tap at Green Flash. . Killer tropical punch erupting from this foaming straw-coloured pour. Lemon rind, grapefruit, cookie dough. Palate is more citrus, decent bitterness for a session, and a fair malt backbone. Crazy good session IPA.

The beer pours a nice honey amber color with a medium head. Aroma of grass and touch of pine. There also is lemon zest. The taste starts out with a good blend of hops and tropical fruits. Bitterness appears on the finish. Tasty beer.

Pours clear gold into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes to hug rim. Caramel, tropical fruit and marshmallow aromas. Caramel and resin upfront turning to earthy bitter pith in the lasting finish.
Very straight forward west coast-style IPA with tons of citrus and pine. Light and neutral malt body.

12oz bottle Green Flash brewed version pours crystal clear amber with a finger of head. Nose is mostly sweet malt, round orangey fruit, melon, caramel. Taste is bitter, dry, stale grass, stale grain, sweet malty caramel, some soft piney orange. Finishes semi sweet and bitter, toast, malty. Feeling let down here.
Pours a clear golden amber color. Aroma is of hops, citrus, grass, bread, and some roastiness. Heavier palate. Flavor is of dry hops, a little pine, bark, and rye. Leaves a dry grassy hop finish.
Clear, deep gold pour with a thin white head. The hoppy aroma has herbal and floral notes. It has a medium body with oily texture and lively carbonation. The taste is bitter with a long finish.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrus, pine, hoppy, bitter. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer and Wine. Nice golden body with medium head. Nose is hoppy, tangy, spicy and floral. Taste is nice and hoppy with strong but subdued burts of hoppiness. Really good stuff. Well rounded and smooth in the finish.
Bottle. Pale orange, just a thin layer of clouds. Pops a nice tart citrusy aroma. Drinks with a snappy bite, lightly astringent, easy to drink. (#6087, 12/31/2015)

Really nice beer- crisp and refreshing. Big beer considering the lower alcohol. Nose of pine and light melon. Long hopped finish. Piney hops throughout. One dimensional flavor profile- luckily, a good one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy App
Enjoyed this on Christmas afternoon when MB wanted something "lighter" than what wed been drinking. Citrusy IPA with a sharp finish. Good not great.

Pours a medium golden color with a finger of white foam. Lots of earthy pine and citrus peel on the nose with some toasted grain, grass and melon. Palate is aggressive considering the abv but after a few sips the nuances shine through and the crispness is refreshing. Focused bitterness, complex hop profile from earthy to citrus with some round unripe honeydew melon lingering with some crisp toasted floral grain.

On draught
Porus a hazy gold with a good head and lots of lacing on the glass.

The aroma is like a freshly opened bag of peletized hops, but not from any particular varietal. Just sort of raw and generically hoppy smelling. Its pretty leafy with some fruitiness, not bad, not really much going on though. 

The flavor pulls off about a medium level of bitterness and again comes in strong with the leafy hop character. Its got some mild pine, some more restrained citrus fruit, and a plesant enough level of driness. 


I guess Im a little befuddled as to why this is a top rated session IPA, its not bad beer, but its tasted just like this every time Ive had it, and I just dont see how its hugely appealing. 
I mean its enjoayble but I guess its not "my kind" of IPA¿
Strong diacetyl, pine, grass, stone fruit. Gross slick buttery texture. Straight up drain pour
Bottle. Pours Golden with good white head. Aroma is hoppy citrus. I get a little hint of rye in it as well. Taste is smooth happiness with a floral grapefruit finish. Pretty good.
Pretty fantastic pale ale/session IPA. Big citrus notes on the nose and beautiful bitter taste. Very pale and very filtered. Good and well-made beer.

Bottle best by March 2016. Poured copper gold with a 2 finger head. Big hop aroma, sticky, green, and herbaceous. Deceptively thick bodied with well hidden alcohol, with super green fresh hop flavor balanced by a bready sweetness. I can see this not being everyones cup of tea, but for me I just cant get enough of that biting green-ness.

Bottle from 2015 Secret Santa -- cheers Jess! Surprisingly crisp, with a dry, bready flavor. The hop profile is strongly damp and citrus, and comes on strong and never really lets down. Brilliant hoppy pale ale / session IPA.
Nice golden yellow hue, passes some light, solid white foam head. Solid bitterness, flowers, pine, resin. Light body.

Tap. Hazy bright gold, with a fluffy white head. Herbal, grassy, and slight resin with some slight sweetness from the malt in the aroma. Flavor is bitter grass, dank, resiny, but not over the top. Lighter soft body, thats a touch light even for the style.

A tasted Fromally 12oz. bottle, it pours a lovely amber hue with very little head and a light hoppy aroma. Nice bite on the tongue with a bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had it out of a Bomber, pours a hazy shady orange, with a white head (hello Phyllis Diller), Wafty hop aroma with a smooth, non bitter hop taste.

Pours a hazy, yellow-gold, with mid-sized, quickly-dissipating head. Strong floral pine-spruce hop aroma. Flavor is quite bitter, with forward hops and a lot of pine-bite. Not really a fan of this or any session IPA--they always feel like Im drinking a light beer. I want more body, more complexity.

500ml bottle. Poured a very nice golden yellow color with a fluffy off-white head. Aroma ws lots of nice floral notes, grapefruit, with citrus lemon notes. Flavor was nice pine resin, caramel - well balanced, with tasty citrus. Very delicious.
Thanks to Bytemesis, this bottle poured a hazy amber with a thick off-white head and soapy lacing. Aromas of citrus, toffee, caramel, and malt. Flavor is medium bitter with a buttery mouthfeel.
22 or 16oz bottle not sure? pours a clear yellow with a white head. pine citrus and hop taste
Clear copper, with a lot of frothy foam. Smells clean, crisp, slightly sweet. Very hoppy, too. Nicely light bodied. Some toasty notes and lots of bright hops. Touch of pine in the finish. Nice stuff.

Bottle. Poured golden with a small head and very little lacing. Bold aromas of citrus, pine, some dank in the background. A mix of malts and hop flavors of pines and fruits are present. Only a slight bitterness which leads into the finish and lingers with a dry ending.

Interesting shaped bomber bottle from Redstone, Andover location. Best by date: 16 May 2016. At the pop of the cap I smelled pine. Farther inspection shows light citrus and a touch of floral hops. Slightly hazy orange in color with light sticky lace along the glass. 
Flavor shows a mild malt backbone with strong pine hop presence. Very light grassy and onion hints. Mouthfeel is crisp and texture is dry with resin residue after the swallow. Body is on the lean side but it does help with the drinkability. 
I wonder if the Green Flash buy out has helped overall or if the product has changed or suffered in anyway. Anyhow, what is in my glass is pretty nice.

On tap at Civil Society. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Citrusy hop bouquet. Big citrus hop notes dominate. Good body and mouthfeel. I can only imagine how good this must have been when it was brewed at Alpine as opposed to Green Flash.

22 oz bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a golden orange with a nice thick white head and some soapy lace that's left behind. The area is good. There is a lot of bright tropical fruits and hop presence on the front end before it moves through to a little bit of a maltiness. There is an earthy bitterness and a a little resin. The flavor should be interesting here. It's not what I wanted it to be. There is such an earthy bitterness that is malt driven. There is a dank sweetness that pokes through on the back end. The mouth feel is thicker and creamy with a lingeringly malty bitterness that carries out long after its gone. I would hope for more from Alpine, but Green Flash sucks. They should leave this alone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy tropical fruit, a touch of malt, pine, earthy yet fruity. Appearance is amber, off white head. Taste is earthy hops, pine, bitter from malt, really really bitter. Mouthfeel is medium body, medium carbonation. Overall, this is...a weird session. Its not what I was expecting. Drinkable, but not even close to a good session IPA.
22 FL OZ ($8.99 bottle) this was a great IPA. only thing I could have wanted was a higher ABV. It was a perfect starter bottle.

Sampled from a bottle, 
this beer had a hazy medium orange pour and it gave a good thick white cover that receded a bit, it left nice lacing on the glass, 

the aromas were grapefruit and orange hops that had herb and grass notes with and faint pine, toasted malt and some malt sweetness, 

tt had flavors of resin and citrus hops with light toasted malt, orange and grapefruit with some malt sweetness, 
the finish was hoppy with a good citrus bitterness that dried the tongue, light malt and fruit following, 

the drink had a light mouth feel, it was creamy and had average carbonation, 

a hoppy session IPA, that has a great nose and was tasty.
Clear orange pour with a nice lasting white head. Great lacing. Aroma is strong piney, dank, and citrusy hops. Taste is grapefruit, pine, and toffee. Clean bitterness. Light body. Great session IPA.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy orange with nice thick white head. Good lacing. Aroma is citrus fruit, pine and biscuits. Taste is moderately bitter with a nice malt backbone. Flavors of pine, floral, caramel, crackers and biscuits. Excellent tasting for a session IPA. Probably the best session IPA I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22 ounce from Comptons Market in Sacramento. Balanced bitterness, crisp, cloudy yellow.
Nice tasty Session IPA with a good hop aroma and flavor. This was a good beer I liked the malt backing and hops finish on this beer.

Bottle. Pours a pretty, vibrant clearish orange with white head. Aroma is really strong citrus, pine, grapefruit. Taste is the same, smooth, refreshing with minimal malt. Would crush this on tap if it was available readily.
Light crackery malt layer lets the hops shine here. Super juicy and citrusy. Good stuff from Alpine.
Nicely done session ipa....tons of hops in nose and mouth...full. citrus flavors....slightly bitter finish...good stuff

Bottle @ Rekvium, Orla and Dolles dødsyge søndagssmagning, 2015. Pours Hazy golden with a white creamy head. Citrus, bready and floral nose and flavor. Soap, crackers and mild yeast. Bitter finish. Good!

Bottle at Bullerup pubben. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of grape, tropical, passion fruit. Taste us rather bitter, light malts, citrus. Pretty old School. Rather dry finish. Nice drinkability.

From bottle. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of old school cascade hops, tropical, pine, citrus, hints of malt and caramel. Old school west coast! Taste is the same. Old school, lots of citrus, light malts, pine, dry finish. My burps taste amazing!

bottle, from Highcraft Beer Market Cary NC. good aroma, sweet. grassy, peach/orange , little green onion. clean golden orange color, ojk head and lace. botter sweet flavor. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. its good, very good flavor for a session. maybe the best session Ive had yet, though I guess technically its a tad over 5% so its really just a pale ale, worth trying, and if on tap Id have it
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: On tap at Dickworths Park. Hazy deep golden with little off-white head. Aroma is light herbal hops, medium/small body, low carbonation, and pretty good lacing. Taste is herbal hops and bitter finish.

If I were to drink this on my birthday, Id have to save it till next August - but I have friends and family who were born in November (one was born on Thanksgiving, in fact!) so this is for them. Pours clear golden orange with a thick, frothy and persistent eggshell head. Resiny hops have the lead in the aroma, while malt and grapefruit co-star. Flavor features hoppy, woody, resin, citrus and malty tones, enjoyable if not spectacular. Mouthfeel presents typical body, but good strong fizz. Every day is somebodys birthday, so celebrate!
22 oz bottle. Hazy Amber with an average off-white head. Aroma is of dank hops, light onion, grass, mango, and pine. Taste is of pine, resin, dank, light garlic, grass, and citrus.

Bottle. The look is clear, a white head, and is golden orange in color. The smell is hoppy, so pure hoppy with splash of hop juice that has hops added. Fruits, grass, good stuff going. Bitter hoppy goodness.

Bottle while watching a western late night. Golden orange with frothy beige head. Nose is resinous hops with some citrus. Tastes of grapefruit, piney, honey, herbal, and resin. Finishes touch of menthol amd sweet. Bitter and crisp carbonation. Very pleasant.

Bottle pours a clear copper/orange win a large khaki head. Aroma of dry grassy citrus hops and caramel malt. Taste of dry resinous bitter piney hops, grassy, some wet dog, light citrus, and caramel malt. Solid IPA.

Bottle from Craft Ale House, and I am absolutely turgid to find this one. Pours relatively clear dark straw with 2-finger off-white head. The head is loud, and sounds like a nymphomaniac opening and closing her labia digitally. Nose is gigantic resin, resin to spare, must be at least 100 plus IBU here, plus pineapple, white pepper. Tastes hoppy, resiny, with a huge IBU load, pineapple, dryness and bitterness throughout, and an overall flavor, nose, and finish that gives hop heads wet dreams. If you are sessioning this, then you better be a goddamned hophead, and you better pack an all day lunch.

Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle: The aroma consists of mango, citrus, grapefruit, light dank hops, and a hint of lemon. It pours a a transparent amber with a large off-white head that has great retention and leaves behind thin soapy rings on the sides of the glass with each sip. The flavor starts with a quick dose of tropical fruits, citrus, and a touch of mango. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit with lighter dank hops, pine, and a touch of herbal hops. Its light bodied with light-moderate carbonation.

Pours almost clear with thin white creamy head. Fresh sweet hoppy nose. Taste is full with both light sweet, fruity hops and solid bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium rich with light to medium carbonation. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Solid ipa methinks.

Bottle. Pours clear gold orange with a white tight head that fades to a thin film and lacing. Aroma has earthy hops like pine spruce and tons of malt which shows earthiness caramel. Taste is really all the above, little lively pine spruce and carbonation with caramel malt. Palate is thin fizzy good carbonation. Easy drinker and very nice.
Draft, growler guys. Hazy golden orange, small white head. Huge hoppy nose, citrus, tropical, and herbal. Heavy bitters for the session ipa style, really full of it. Nice.

22oz bottle. Cloudy, tiny floater-laden, brassy hue with a medium white head. Resinous hop smell. Dry hoppy bitterness with grapefruit peel, grassy & light piney notes. Medium body and medium+ carbonation. An excellent session IPA.

Bottle into a glass. Nice gold pour. Thin, bubbly white head. Aroma is a bit buttery (glad to see some things never change), soap, citrus, bit of grass. Taste is pleasantly bitter, orange peel, lemon zest, Finishes dry, with a slight puckering bitterness. Lingering sweetness with a bit of orange juice.

22 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 3/18/2016. Green Flash bottling. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy deep golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky off white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, lemon/orange peel, pine, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a crisp malt/bitterness balance and zero bitter astringency after the finish. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, and resinous/sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 5.25%. Overall this is an awesome pale ale style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Aroma: pine, citrus, floral, 
Appearance: clear golden, white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Green Flash bottled version. Clear orange color with slightly off-white head. Aroma is really intense for such a low ABV beer. Definitely west coast style hop profile with lots of pine, grapefruit and herbal / woody notes. Starts bitter up-front and gets even more bitter towards the finish and lingers in the aftertaste. Slight malt, but mainly its just about the hops. Grapefruit and orange pith come to mind, with the same abrasive, harsh bitterness. Body is medium with good carbonation. Overall this is a well made beer but doesnt really stand up with anything. Classic hop profile and a lot of bitterness, which lowers the drinkability factor for me.

Bottle. A clear golden color with a white head. A robust hoppy aroma not at all like other Session IPAs, although the abv here is hardly in the true session IPA category This is just a really good IPA.

The best session IPA. Pine and citrus fruit flavour. Strong carbonation and easy drinkability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Alpine Beer Company - The Pub, in Alpine, California. Clear golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Hoppy pine aroma, citrus, hay, floral, peach, some mango. Hoppy pine flavor, grassy, hay, peach notes, grapes, some floral notes. Good SIPA.

GF stamped bottle. Best by date was 03-2016. Apparently theyre giving their IPAs a 6 month shelf life.................. Big letdown. Pours a pretty clear orange/yellow with fluffy white head. Aromas of slight citrus, maltiness, resin, grass. Flavor had some lemon notes, pine, grass, malt sweetness, heavily bitter. Light body and a thin texture. Bubbly carbonation and a bitter finish. Would have loved to try this before the whole GF thing to see if its just that effecting it or if it really isnt this good.

Clear copper pour, nice frothy beige head. The nose is citrusy and bright with some caramel malt. The flavor is hoppy and bitter enough to keep the caramel malt sweetness at bay, but it comes out a bit on the finish. Medium bodied with a fairly sturdy malt backbone and soft fizzy carbonation. Decent stuff, but below par for Alpine hoppy stuff.
Pours a mostly clear golden color with white head. Pine, citrus, and resin on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with a floral hop note.
Clear gold pour. Massive hop aroma. Resin and citrus. Pretty clean finish. Cerveza con caracter

Pours a hazy light amber color with a cream colored head. The smell is toasted malt, citrus, green hops. The taste is bright, fresh hops, citrus, grapefruit, toasted malt ending dry and somewhat bitter. The body is light+ with tight. active carbonation.

Light hazed medium dark gold. Light but frothy head, recedes fairly quickly to spitty foam and ring. Pungent resin sweet fruit hoppy aroma, juicy fresh, nice. Same taste piney,big bitter. Drinks like a good 7% beer. Lot of pine and resin. Slicker and more malt flavor/body than a average session ipa. Very bold hop character.

Bottle from Colonial Spirits.
Fairly clear light golden color with a decent sized long lasting off white head. Light mineral water and bready maltiness with plenty of citrus pine and resin to counter. I could drink that all day even if it was my birthday.

Clear golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, resin, citrus, onion and pine. Bitter hoppy flavour, pine and resin. Dito finish. Nice! But calling a >5% beer a session IPA? I dont get it.(from 66cL bottle @ ZZT XII, Getting Joesd to it, Oirschot. Thanks for sharing, Abijen!)
This is good for a low end IPA. I had a pint at their restaurant in Alpine and I could have had 10 more if it werent for my folks being there with me. Im with the other 295 reviewers. Great stuff.
Hazy gold pour, 2 fingers of head and a ring of lace. Pine resin and grapefruit up front, cracker like malt. Grassy and quite dank. Extremely drinkable.

22 oz. bottle from Woodmans Market, Waukesha, WI (best by March 18, 2016). Dark orange pour with lively carbonation and a frothy off-white head. Bright aroma of fresh pine and grapefruit rind. Bitter hop taste of pine needles and wet grass. Finish is bit thinner than a normal IPA but that is to be expected. Top of the class for session IPAs.
22 ounce bottle. Pours golden orange with a smallish white head. Mild aroma of citrus, floral, and malt. Taste is citrus, floral, malt, and some pine. Well balanced. Nice.

Draft at Atomic. Pours yellow gold with an off white head. Aroma is mosaic hop mango, scallion. Some pine too. Flavor matches the mosaic aroma... Mango, heavy scallion on caramel malts. Grassy bitterness in the finish.

Poured from tap at Atomic Cafe Vegas light golden orange with a one finger head. Aromas of fresh citrus dank pine and resin. Taste is a mix of malt and hops with a nice hint of grass onion and a lingering hop bitterness. Nice.

22oz bottle. Tannish gold pour, small head, very little lacing. Bold aromas of citrus, pine, some dank in the background. Dominate bitterness right from the start. A mix of malts and hop flavors of pines and fruits are under this bitterness, which leads into the finish and lingers with a dryness in my mouth.
bottled - nice pale golden color. Great hop aroma and flavor. Nice balance between hops and sweetness. Excellent.

Thanks! to Abijen. 650 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT XIII. Lightly hazy golden, little white head. Nose is chockful of lovely onion hops, garlic, pine peel. Taste is rich grass, onion, garlic, dank, rich, light malts. Very nice rich hop oil body. Very nice beer, at 5.25 % you could just as easily call this one an IPA as opposed to a Session IPA but that is marketing. Kids these days with their session fluff.
Glad this has made it to bottles. Glad to have grabbed one and hope it is in full local rotation. Very good hoppy session ale, refreshing, piney and bitter.

Surprised that this is 5.25% and a session IPA. Nice yellow orange pour. Some white foam coats the glass with decent lacing. Nose is nice nothing crazy but nice citrus zest. Flavour is thin with a harsh bitterness that I'm puzzled by.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. slightly hazy pale orange color with a medium frothy looking head. nice bold mandarin, white grapefruit, candy aroma. some crystal type malt sweetness in the flavor to liven up the sessiony malt bill. citrusy, spicy, earthy hop notes. almost medium bodied. one of the better ones.

Bottle @ ZZT XII. Clear orange golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma is malts, grassy hops. Taste malts, grassy hops, hops, fresh, crisp, nice bitterness. Perfect suitable body and carbonation. Superb!

Bottle @ ZZT12. Clear golden with a small to medium sized white head. Smells citra hops, fruity, hops, fresh. Tastes hops, fresh, fruity, slightly malty. Great taste. Thin to medium body, soft to medium carbo.
Goud helder bier met een kleine witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, bitter, sinassappelschil, dennen. Smaakt fruitig, bitter, dennen. Heerlijk .
Bomber. Slightly hazy orange pour with a smaller white head. Floral and citrus aroma and taste. Slightly bitter finish. Good.

22 oz bottle. Pours clear copper gold with a big frothy white head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is bready malts with some fruity floral hops with a little onion.

The flavor is a little sweet bready malt and fruit with a lot of bitter resiny onion hops. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation,

Overall, a nice hoppy session IPA. Good except for onion notes.

On tap at the Downtown Artery in Fort Collins. Clear orange appearance. Nice, albeit straightforward aroma, almost bursting with citrusy hops and tropical fruits. Similar flavor, adding medium hop bitterness and a hint of malt sweetness. Smooth and easy to drink, pretty nice overall.
Pours orange with a medium white fluffy head. Aroma is herbal, tropical citrus and resin. Taste is bitters and a hint of citrus sweetness. Medium bodied, sticky finish and overall a great IPA.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately to heavily hoppy (grapefruit, lemon oil, grass), with a note of plastic.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly astringent.

Bit of a mixed bag...nice appearance, mouthfeel, and flavor balance, but the aroma is really simple (citric/grassy hops and little else) and has a plastic off note. Drinkable but thats about it.

Bright golden pour, thin head, spotty lace. Aroma was straight up hops, pine, resin, candied fruit, spruce tips. Flavors were super bitter, long lingering finish yet remained smooth throughout. Slick and oily mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Wouldnt necessarily call this is session IPA but its an awesome American pale. Maybe the best Ive ever had. Super balanced, well rounded, smooth city. Awesome.
Draft in Rehoboth Beach in early September. Nice hoppy aroma, good bitterness level. Had to have 2.

Green Flash Bomber. Best by 3/18/16. Guessing that means its a month old. Just showed up in Chicago 4 days ago. So decently fresh. Pour is golden orange. Aroma is hops. Not hoppy. Straight hops. On the super dank pine end of the spectrum. Taste is intensely bitter hops. It really tastes like licking the inside of a picked off the vine fresh hops. A lupulin smoothie. Completely out of balance and lacking any malt. Too much hops for such a light beer. 

This thing is a damn lupulin smoothie.

Lots of presence and for a session IPA. Bitter and resinous. Pine needles. Maybe floral or berry. Possibly grass or soap. Toastiness and good carbonation cover the lighter body. Lingering bitterness. Not my favorite hop profile, and 5.25% is a little big for a session, but I think they?re on to something with how full this feels.
Aroma is dank hops, spices and very light citrus/fruit. The flavor is hops, citrus/fruit, malts and a mix of dry, bitter and surprisingly smooth in the finish.
Low-alcohol, but still light and lively on the palate. Really bitter, with elements of green tea, pine, lavender and apricot. Long finish. Nice spice.

Pours a semi cloudy orangey gold with a med egg shell white head that dissipates but still leaves lacing. Great aroma full of pine resin, papaya, grapefruit and some biscuity malt. Robust hop flavors for a session IPA - big bitter pine and grapefruit peel, a tropical note, hint of grass and malt.

Bottle from Xroads. Poured a good looking honey amber body under a foamy white head. Aroma is lightly dank, touch of pine, lots of dry citrus, potpourri. Flavor is grains, dough, toast, light dankness and dry citrus rind. Really full mouthfeel with foamy carbonation that I didnt care for. Overall solid.
Bomber, golden yellow color, good smooth hoppy pine flavor and nose, has a bite of a bite on the finish like Green Flash, quite quaffable

Big bottle. Pours clear orange, white head, lacing that doesnt last. Aroma is hops. Flavor is well balanced hops, biscuity malt, mildly bitter finish, dry. Amazing flavor for a session ale. The balance is what sets this one apart.

Bomber from Uptown Market. Pours a clear orange hue with a small white head. A big citrus nose. Really robust fruity hops, grass, biscuit, oranges. Light sweet hop resin. Very good pale. Drinkable as it can be. Lovely.
Bottle. Aroma is leaves, dank grass, pine, citrus, and mango. Tastes moderately bitter. Nice pine and dank grass mostly, some biscuits, light herbal hops. Very nice.

(Green Flash) Bottle. Rating #1500!

A: Cloudy orange with a ton of bubbles scraping against the side of the glass. Nearly white head and lacing.

N: Blast of pine, pineapple, and grapefruit. Deep draughts of earth and a bit of mango to follow things up. Cracker as the base.

T: Very bitter with only the slightest bit of malt underneath.

M: Medium-light body, bone dry, prickly carbonation, a touch of alcohol.

O: Its a session IPA, its an APA, its a bird, its a plane. Whatever it is, its pretty well done, but I find that its a bit too earthy for my palate, as well.
Solid IPA. Lots of citrus making for a bright beer. Just enough backbone and bitterness. Good stuff.

Citrus aroma, onion, garlic and little dankness. Mainly citrus though. Has a nice pop of bitterness and lots of grapefruit, tropical fruit juice and garlic. Lots of garlic its interesting. Overall a pretty good session ipa. Not going to rush out to get it again but definitely worth trying.

Bottle. Lightly hazed amber with a fine white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with notes of perfume, pine, green onion, damp lawn. Medium bodied, syrupy, medium sweetness, medium+ bitterness. Basic crystal malt and green vegetable hops in a short finish.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a hazed orangish amber with a sticky white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Orange peel. Flavor is bitter with strong orange peel bitterness. Light bodied, lively carbonation. Nice, bitter finish. Overall, great beer.

Bottle. Golden-brass with a big sudsy white head. The aroma is fresh citrus and some pine. The taste, like the nose, features grapefruit and resins set in a light caramel malt base. The bitterness seems a bit over the top at times, but Ill forgive this. Finishes long and dry. Top shelf stuff bro. Paired excellent with a steak and potato burrito.

This is far and away the most surprising, balanced, and awe invoking session IPA I have ever drank. The nose is strong with hops and resin, and upon first taste that is exactly what you get. Hops, resin, and a bitter finish but harmony is found between the hops flavor, which is nicely balanced by the malt. As the beer oxidized it rounded the edges of the hops and resin and brought forth the notes of citrus and pine. Amazing mouth feel and excellent carbanation made this session preform among more traditional west coast IPAs.
Bottle. Copper with medium off white head. Pine, grapefruit, resin and honey. Medium mouthfeel and carb. Good.

Pours a finger and a half of head on a hazy straw body.
The aroma is bright lemon, grapefruit and pineapple.
The taste is dry and metallic bitterness with a solid bitter finish.
The texture is crisp and fizzy.
Its really good.
On tap dark orange with a white head. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste follows nose.

Growler from taps. Aggressive west coast hip profile with lots of grapefruit and lemon peel. Lighter body and alcohol though to make this a more sessionable drink. Really tasty and takes me back old school.

Pours orange with a small white soapy head that dissipates quickly. Light lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, mango, a little peach, pine needles, and a little cracker. Taste is much of the same with juicy citrus hops and a subtle malt backbone. Finish is bright and dry with a clean mouthfeel. Overall an excellent beer.

Tap at Sidedoor. Big, bold, earthy hops. Pretty solid beer, but a little resinous, earthy, caramel centered. Hazy orange-tan body. Frothy head. Solid offering in some respects, but has that earthy caramel flavor I pretty much consider a flaw. Massive hop tones, but nothing else impressive about it. Earthy butter bomb.

one sip and my mouth is overwhelmed with the hoppiness of it, a bitter not harsh or metallic. at the same time not sticky resin-y as fresh hops can be. maybe hops as hops. how to reach that balance. clear yellow with the slightest orange blush. moderate white head. the bitterness clings but does not pulverize, the malt slides by the tongue distracted by the hops. this is so well balanced..

Hazy golden orange pour with a thin soapy white head and light lacing ..... aroma of awesome piney hops, peaches, oranges, (citrusy/tropical fruits), mango and grapefruits ..... taste is of piney hops, peaches, oranges, grapefruits, mango, pineapple .... lingering piney and bitter hop flavor .... mouthfeel is a little slick and oily ..... body is a bit on the thin side ..... awesome apa!!!

9/29/15. On tap at Craft on Draft. Orange pour with a nice off-white head, great lacing. Great aroma, bold hop characteristics, tropical fruits, citrus, dank, piney. Bitter taste, more hop bitterness than expected, but still lots of good hop character in the flavor. Good stuff!

On tap at Maxs in Baltimore. Pine needles and grapefruit nose. Flavor mimics the the aroma. Lots of bitter citrus. Breads malts balance by resiny hops are a nice combination here. Very lightly carbonated. Delicious.

Tallahassee, Fl - on tap at Brass Tap - Midtown. Sparkling light copper pour, nice film of a white head with decent lacing. Nice spruce accents in the aroma with hint over overripe peaches. Solid flavor with some mango fruitiness, nice citrus bitterness. Nice thick mouthfeel. Nice to see this brewer making its way into Florida.
Draught at The Beer Trappe. Light hoppy orange color IPA. Medium malt build. Green Flash brewed, I assume.

Large tan head, lasting, nice lace. Murky, copper/gold hued brew. Nicely fruity, citrusy, danky nose, yummy. Med/full bodied, overly soft carbonation, juicy, lil oily. Dry malts, juicy, chewy hops, grapefruit flavors, grass. Fuckin yummy but the body was a bit sly cuz of the carbonation level, otherwise damn good hop juice! Draft/growlered from statelineliquors.
Had this on tap at bait shop with kristen brian sara rusty tony... nice clear hold color with pine hoppy taste. .good shiz
Pine needle and citrus aroma. Taste is citrus, pine, and fruity happiness. Delicious. Orange dark cloudy pour at el bait shop in Des Moines

From a 32 oz growler ... well, actually, the entire 32 oz growler .., into a lager glass. 

Only about 18 hours since this was filled yet pours with a rather minimal head. I saw plenty of fine head as the growler was filled (and beer overflowed into the drain). Moreover, the thin head has very good retention, and the feel is only slightly below , so Ill rate this as if the carbonation level were a touch higher. 

A: Amber body with plenty of fine-grained carbonation bubbles. 

Magnificent hoppy aroma featuring oranges and other citrus tones. 

The flavor follows but is more juicy and less citrus rind than the aroma suggests. Very flavorful; very fruity; mild bitterness goes a bit higher in the aftertaste. 

O: as good as, or better than, any APA Ive had. This has the intensity of an IPA but with lower (average) bitterness.

On tap at Scion in Silver Spring, MD. 

Hazy, coppery orange with a small off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit, tangerine, lemon and biscuits. 

Taste of citrus, pine resin, pine a, tropical fruit, biscuits and gooseberries. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonization. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4 oz pour on draft at Spacebar. Golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, grapefruit and lemon citrus, pine. Tastes of floral, grapefruit and lemon citrus, pine, light caramel. Medium body with a dry finish.

Small shaker showing light honey 

The nose shows notes of cactus, cucumber, pine, and light cannabis. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Flavors show a lot of clean tropical fruit and clean fruit forwardness. Upon warming up the corn malts appear on the finish hence I suggest drinking this one cold.

draft that poured a medium orange color with minimal white head and some nice lacing. this beer is the bomb...a huge citrus mango nose of hops that burst all over. mild to medium malts which is nice. the flavor is ten fold very very good mild malt base with a huge citrus hop flavor that burst all over your tongue .this is a great ipa with a huge flavor and nice bitterness start to finish...

Draft. Large off-white head atop amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grape, some grapefruit, light grapefruit rind. Taste is just as is smells. Delicious! Light-medium body, light acidity, very drinkable.

On tap at old alpine place. clear dark orange. Pine citrus nose. Taste hoppy bitter with good clean hoppy finish. Really too big n hops for style but still loved it and gave it great rating despite that fact.
Great citrus and floral aromas are a nice start. Hazy gold and a white head that leaves lots of lace. Flavors of orange, tangerine, and lemon. A bitter but pleasant finish makes this a solid choice.
Draft. Slightly hazy golden color, white head. Big grapefruit aroma. Taste is bitter citrus. More bitter than I expected.

Pours a clear orange with a small, persisting head. Nose is loads of tropical fruits with mango, papaya and grapefruit. In the mouth its dank hops with the same tropical notes and some biscuit flavors. Medium, smooth pine bitterness towards the end. Excellent!

Draught @ Alpine Beer Co Pub, Alpine, CA

Pours clear orange with a foamy head. Aroma of juicy fruits, biscuity malts, grassy hops, pine,resin and citrus. Taste is smooth, hoppy and biscuity with loads of fruits, pine, resin, citrus and grass. Finish is lingering bitter, hoppy, grassy and resinous. Awesome.

Draught @ Alpine Beer Co Pub, Alpine, CA. Pours a golden colour with a firm white head. Aroma of juicy fresh lemon, mild kiwi and herbal notes. Flavour of crisp juicy citrusy bitterness, orange gummybears, bright herbal notes and mild biscuit notes. Medium bodied. Very bright and refreshing.
Draught @ the brewpub, Alpine. Aroma has pineapples and peaches. Flavour has pineapples, tropical fruits and some biscuity malt. Also grapefruit. Juicy.

Tap @ Alpine Beer Co. Pub, Alpine.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Hoppy aroma, floral notes, pine and caramel, lemon also. Resinous hoppy flavor, tropical fruits, caramel and pine. Very good. 
3515

Tap. Very excited to find an Alpine beer. Golden color. Strong citrus, almost soapy aroma. Im expecting a hop blast and then my first reaction is this is a little water. Once I adjust this is exceptional. Crisp, abundance of hops with a slight caramel malt to balance. Toned down but exceptional.
On tap at Sauced. Pours a yellow amber color with a bit of a head. Tropical and some floral hop flavor.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2015 Draft. Need label. Pours orange gold white head - nose and taste of citrus, orange peel, cracker malt - medium body
Bronze pour with nice white head. Big, and I mean big hop nose. Flavor to match with a smooth clean finish. Glad I was able to finally taste an ale from Alpine.

Pours a clear golden brown on tap with thin off-white head that leaves great lace. Aroma of big resinous pine over sweet caramel malt. Taste is more towards the pine with just a slight malty backbone. Soft carbonation with upfront bitterness that subsides quickly. Nice pale ale overall.
A stunning aroma followed up by a beer that is an accurate pale ale. Yet the aroma makes you think you are about to drink an IPA.

On tap in Cleveland (OH)

A beer like this couldnt be passed up despite the reputation of Alpine these days. After trying it I may give a few more drafts a shot. If it is anything to go by theyve not lost their A game in cranking out world class West Coast hop bombs.

Aroma / Appearance - A bronze carbonated body shimmers below a layer of protective white head. Bright rosy hops, fresh citrus, and floral aspects lazily float upwards like dandelion puffs in a summer breeze.

Flavor / Palate - A first sip delays the sharp bitterness for mere seconds before it explodes on the tongue and throat. Oranges, cloves, and resin coat the corners of the mouth with a sessionable bitterness that is present without being abrasive. If this were on draft at an event Id have no problems with ordering a pint or two while socializing.

Clear medium gold, small white head. Sharp citrus hop aroma with some sweetness. Acidic, sturdy bittering, lots of sour citrus juice. Body tips a little heavy. Caramel and ample hops at the end. On tap, Brass Tap Midtown.
Clear Amber, soapy sticky head. Lots of citrus with undertones of tropical, and a touch of dank, medium bitter. Drinks like an ipa, smooth mouth. Really nice and my first from inside GA state lines.
On draft at Pizza Paradiso in Alexandria. It is a clear gold color with an off white head. The aroma is somewhat citrus and the taste is bitter malty one
On draft at Pizza Paradiso in Georgetown. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of tropical fruity, with some nice malty notes. Bitter finish.

Amber color with a decent white head. Aroma is slightly piney hops. Flavor is light pine, pleasantly astringent with a light finish.

Wife: 4.15
On tap at the Malt Shoppe. Golden orange pour, nice subtle citrus hops. 14.4

16oz in pint glass. St. Paul,MN.

Pours transparent coppery-orange with abundant white head. 

Aroma is heavy on citrus. Lemon and grapefruit in particular. A little resin. Some maltiness. Some pineapple back notes. 

Taste is bitter with some mild sweetness to balance. Pretty well done. 

Body is medium. Thicker texture. Long bitter finish.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Amber pour. Nose of piney grapefruit. Flavor is dry pine and grapefruit with some mineral aspects. Little malt. Dry bitter finish.  Re-rate, this time bottle.  Like others, surprised to find that everything came together better in the bottled version vs tap.  Pungent pine and citrus with crystal malt.  Pine and grapefruit.  JUICY.  Dry.  +3
On tap at Piece. Pours golden orange with small white head. Aromas of pine, grapefruit, and little citrus. Nice amount of bitterness with citrusy and piney hops. Light malt backbone. Solid APA.
Tap. Pours a transparent amber with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma and taste are hop forward with a nice malty background. Hint of citrus.

32 oz. growler poured into a snifter. Clear deep orange body. Nice white head. Grapefruit hop aroma. Caramel malt. Taste is just like the nose. Aggressive grapefruit up front. Hefty caramel malt behind it. Not sweet, more bready and toasty. Strong bitterness in the back end. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Straightforward and very tasty.
Growler - Pours light amber. Nose is lots of citrus and grassy notes. Taste is lemons, oranges, tangerines, evergreen with a little bitterness in the end. Nice!
Draft at Happy Gnome. Pours clear amber gold with some white head. Nose is grassy. Taste adds some nice sweetness. One of the better session IPAs.
Tap at Dig. Grassy, earthy hop nose, stone fruits, oranges. Deep orange amber color. Great hops. Very good, not quite as wonderful as I had anticipated, but good. Maybe not fresh enough.
Very citrusy, orange peel, and piney aromas, subtle yeasty, butteriness. Clear dark orange with a fully lasting white head. Dry, pretty bitter, a little spicy. Light-medium bodied.
Fresh juicy hop and sharp citrus aroma. Thicker off white head and golden orange body. Fresh bitter hop flavor and very dry citrus with some light grassy notes. Crisp and clean on the palate.
Why brewed at green flash? Really good hop flavour and aroma. On tap at deciccio ardsley.

Draft at sb. Pours a hazy burnished medium amber with a loose white. Gorgeous fruity nose, lots of grapefruit and tropical notes. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Toasty caramel and grapefruit and pineapple on the mid palate. Mild finish.
One of my fav places in SD for beer. This one. Is very hoppy floral in. Nature. The flavor has some mild malts. The hop flavor is mostly flora hops very bitter/smooth character if that makes sense.
Prototypicial ipa. bALANCED, PINEY,CITRUSY WITH SOME TROPICAL FRUIT CHARACTER. Could be slightly drier in the finish for my taste, but otherwise a great pale.

On tap @ Chucks 85th. Pours bright clear copper with thin white head. Aroma is faintly roasty pale malt and light fresh earthy hops. Taste is similar - clean pale malt and fairly sizable hops, big pine and dark citrus notes through the finish. Lingers slightly bitter. Really the only thing that distinguishes this from an IPA is the lighter malt body. As a pale, excellent hop flavor.

Thick white head. Light Amber color. Dry fragerent nose with lots of pine and citrus notes. Super well balanced, super dry, super hoppy, super Uber good. Hugely quaffable. Everything I want from a California pale ale.
Great citrus and pine hop aroma. Flavors were bold with a nice bitterness that was balanced by a nice caramel malt background. Medium palate.
On tap (guest) at Fatheads in Portland, RBSG. Orange-tinted gold. Hay, green grass, a bit of resin, bready malts, moderate bitterness. Densely hoppy, nice.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 2017 Huge bump... really the best session IPA out there.  Of course it is higher abv than many.  But has nice nose and nice flavors.  Very hoppy not bitter but only slight.  Nice head continues with swirling.  Full bodied for abv.  Impressive!!!  I would like to have this next to gotoIPA

2015 (3.7) A really nice pale ale. Nice bittering hops. Not malty. Nice aroma. Enjoyable. A bit thin.

Draft sample. The beer is a clear copper color with a white head of foam. The aroma has juicy citrus and a bit of pine resin. Big juicy citrus in the taste, mild bitterness. Crisp and refreshing. Medium carbonation. Very nice beer.
Draft - Sweet citrus and grapefruit hops. Clear gold with a decent white head. Sweet grapefruit, nice bitterness and a mellow finish. Solid.
growler pour from horrocks. Golden with one finger head. Fairly light body with all the hops youd expect. Citrus and light pine. Quite nice.
On draft at Mad Mex South Hills. Poured cloudy orange with scattered splotches of white lace. Orange, tangerine, pine. Bitter finish that softened half way through. Great APA.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor are pushing IPA status with the hop character; grapefruit, citrus, herbal, mild resin and earthy with a pale toasted malt base, moderate bitterness though strong for an APA, solid drinker, I hope we get this stuff fresh now that it is in the area.

My Bottom Line:
Chewy cereals and their caramelized accents welcome coniferous hops and their bitterness in this personable pint.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the hazy amber.
-Resinous bitterness balances out the finish.
-This one wasnt as crisp as the usual Alpine hoppy brews, to me.
-Hops also contribute citrusy fruitiness, unsurprisingly.

On tap at the brewery taproom.

On tap at Park Burger RiNo pours a clear gold with some fluffy, lacing white head. Nose is what you expect from Alpine, grassy, straw, lemon, some mild herbs, lightly dank, some garlic scape. Flavor follows, just a kiss of light malt, then grass, pine, orange, tangerine, herbs, soap. Medium bodied, dry and very drinkable. A treat.

Draft at rons. Pours clear golden with a small white head. The aroma is heavy on pine and grapefruit. The taste has a light bitterness, loaded with citrus. This is delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Dutchs. Keg received yesterday, dated March 12. Despite being nearly 3 months old, this is still drinking impressively hoppy. Nice bigger grapefruity and citrusy hop, its IPA-level hoppy. Kind of spicy and peppery. Assertively bitter, too. Essentially what many would call a "session IPA" -- but more balanced, fuller than the typical SIPA, with a substantial biscuity malt backbone. Hop forward for sure, but there is some malt to appreciate beneath it. Just a touch musty, slight hint of a metallic edge, but the age is not bothering me anywhere near as much as I thought it would, this is all minor. Along with the big hop aroma, theres a bigger bitter taste too, for a pale ale. Pretty assertive. Lighter sweet. Clear orange color. Thin off-white head, leaves some decent splotches of lace, kind of loose. Good head retention. Medium body. Smooth, kind of soft lighter carbonation. Dry finish. Definitely a solid pale ale. Hopefully we get the opportunity to try this fresh next year -- itd probably even better.

On tap at industry. Pours a clear copper orange. Why
Hire head. Aroma of dank hops and light citrus. Taste is a bit overly bitter for me. Pretty west coast. Lighter body and high carb. Just too bitter to be crushable.
June 4, 2015 - on tap at Gerst Haus. Clear golden pour with head and lacing. Piney and some citrus hops with some malt in aroma and taste.

Keg @ Republic 7 Corners. Gold with a creamy white head. Mango and grapefruit meat sugar coated pine cones. Dry hitter character. Dried pine needles and green grass. A touch floral. Soft honey for balance. Quite drinkable. Soft carb. Great if you like things on the dry end of the spectrum.
Orange pour, faint white head. Nose is citrus, mostly grapefruit. Bitter. Middle is sweet malt and citrus zest. Finish is bitter, not too heavy. Well balanced beer.

Pours translucent bright orange with a sandy white colored head. The aroma brings smooth and sweet herbal hops, rich and green, skunky dank, and pleasant. The flavor is similar, super smooth hops with a balanced dry body and ending, but no bite, just smoothness.

Growler from Daily Growler, UA: murky amber pour with a slightly frothy white head. aroma of pine, floral, citrus, malt. tastes are even floral, tropical, grass. little musty. the palate it perfect - medium, creamy. finishes floral moderate bitter. very nice.

Growler thanks to Gibson. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with small frothy white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong tropical fruit and pine. Thin mouth, grapefruit, pine, light bitterness, crushable, very nice.
On tap at Capones. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized off white head. Pine, citrus, floral, and some breadiness.

Tap at The Beer Company in San Diego. Ordered because its part of their kill the keg promotion after it was passed over during recent brewery tap room visit. Pint glass filled to capacity. Limited head. Golden/copper color. Aroma is pine and floral hoppy. Great lacing. Taste is bright and relatively refreshing. Slight initial sweetness. Clean mouthfeel. Aftertaste is mostly bitter with hops running the show. Nice finish. Decent pale ale.
Tap at the beer company in San Diego. Light copper with bubbly white head. Hoppy nose. A tiny amount of skunkiness but might have been an old keg. Resin but crisp. Decent, maybe a half birthday beer.

Draft at Good Dog. Hazy orange gold pour with a slim white head that left a nice show of lace. Nice hop aroma. Orange peels. Pineapple rind. Grapefruit pith. Browned lemons. Watermelon rind. Has a pleasant earthiness to it as well. Autumn leaves. Mushroomed tree stumps. Chanterelles. Medium toffee malts. Mildly juicy. Semi-fruity but a good dry spicy finish. Alpine keeps surprising me with new solid variations of IPAs. Good stuff!

On tap at Happy Gnome. Pours a clear orange with a gold hue and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a dank pine note with a decent amount of bitter grapefruit and a sweet grain backbone. Flavor has some bitter grapefruit and pine with a hint of citrus and an earthy grain backbone.

Hoppy ipa with a nice malty backbone finishes really bitter and dry. Had a draft pour at sheffields. Pours gold with a white head. Awesome beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Golden. Pour. Nice lacing. Orangey aroma flavor is spocier with citrus notes, mandarin, tangerine, dry and spiced finish. Been waiting a long time totry this one and now its fresh just down the street.

On tap at Pinocchios. Clear orange with a white head. Nose is orange, mango, light pine and pink grapefruit. Resiny medium body with bright carb. Taste is pine, grapefruit and lemon zest with a hint of sweetness. Long bitter finish.
A little on the bitter side. It had a big hoppy taste but it seemed very high alpha heavy which gave it a bit of an off taste but it wasn't enough to make it undrinkable by any means.

Tap at Brouwers Cafe. Pours dark gold some head and lots of lacing. Nose is grapefruit and dank. Flavours grapefruit, resin, grassy hops and peach. Taste medium/big bitter, light sweet. Full body, lively carbonation and a lasting bitterness. Beauty.
