Poured up on cask at the brewpub, dry hoped with Citra, with sort of a dirty yet clear gold body with loose like white head. The aroma offers up some grapefruit, citrus cotton candy and floral hop notes around the edges. The taste, despite the cask pour, un leashes a bounty of hoppy goodness thats a mix of grapefruit, mango, spicy hops and a white wine like quality. There are various flavor hops to start and then the experience flows into increasing levels of drying bitter hoppiness into the finish. It has a fairly thin sessionable body making for a crisp pulsating flavored Pale Ale. Damn.

From notes.  First reviewed 8/8/2011.  Poured from a growler into a tulip. Thanks readbaron, Im glad it arrived safely.

Clearly filtered, Hoppy Birthday has a transparent copper orange color with visible resplendent carbonation rising from the bottom to refresh its creamy white head. The head loiters and leaves a good splattering of lace on the glass.

This has a monster hop aroma. Lots of floral notes, mango, orange rind, and pineapple.

Up front the sweet pale malt sets the table for the hops. The hop profile is pretty amazing overall. Lots of mango, grapefruit, and pineapple give this a great, well rounded bitterness. Being a lighter beer, this is something I could easily drink all day during the summer.

This has a nice, smooth carbonation that really helps to keep the beer clean. I like when there is no unpleasantness lingering - the bubbles lift up and carry away any residue so each sip starts out with a refreshed palate. 

This is pretty damn good. There are four pale ales I find worth my time, every time. Zombie Dust edges out Hoppy birthday on my personal favorite list, with Daisy Cutter and Alpha King tied for a distant third. That is splitting hairs, though, this is another win for Alpine. You can trust them to do right by the hop gods.

On tap at ABC brewpub.  Light slightly murky pour with plenty of frothy white foam that clings to the glass.  Nose is a good dose of floral notes hops, and slight citrus.  Taste follows the nose with very little by way of a malt backbone.  Crisp and refreshing.  At 5% abv this by far one of the best sessionable beers around.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint on tap at ABC.  Aroma is some citrus and just a bit of floral aromatics.  Taste is some citrus and just a bit of bitter bite.  Tons of flavor for a beer that is is low ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler. Pours a sexy orange with creamy white head that sticks to the glass. Subtle aroma of pine. Flavors of grapefruit and bubble gum. Super hoppy, like an IPA, but lighter in body. Finish is bitter, but Im not.  There?s a birthday party in my mouth.

Growler shared by Sean. Thanks! Pours a rich glowing golden bright vibrant hue. A healthy haze, but not dark or murky. Frothy decent sized whitish head dies to thicker film, laces ok. Aromas are a rich vibrant melange of hops, with  some citrus, bubblegum, tropical fruits. Mellow grapefruit and lemon, more orange and tropical elements, grass and touches of fruit. Some mellow pale malts, more fruit, vibrant flavor hops. Initial is lighter, a bit towards medium, but still light. A vibrant citrusy and tropical hopping offers lots of fruity flavors, touches of pineapple, passionfruit, and dry grass and florals. Lemon, mellow sweetness offers touches of bread, pale malts, more fruit. Middle is mellow swet and bitter, a good dryness mixes with a healthy fruit melange from the hops. Rich, vibrant, flavorful hops. Not overly bitter, very drinkable, a touch of bubblegum and a faint waft of pine keeps it honest. Really complex and enjoyable hopping with a sessionable malt body. Pleasant and tasty.

A: Crystal clear golden orange body.  Massive white head.  Excellent retention and substantial lacing.

S: Tropical aromas dominate.  Grapefruit, orange, mango, maybe some tangerine in there as well.  Underlying notes of freshly cut grass.

T: Profound grapefruit, light bready malts, floral hops, orange, mango.

M: Light to medium bodied.  Assertive carbonation, moderate bitterness, nice crisp bite in the finish.  Epitome of "sessionable."

O: This is right there with Zombie Dust as far as pale ales go.  I keep forgetting how low of an ABV this is and Id think it was a massive IPA based upon the hops if I didnt know better.

Gravity cask at Toronado SD. Slightly hazy orange gold with some white bubbles. Smells like candy hops, good amount of green herbal dry hopping, very light fruity yeast. Flavor follows with orange citrus candy hops, with just enough sweetness--not caramelly. Finishes dry with earthy bitterness peaking at a 5. Low cask carbonation with a medium body. Very tasty.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Orange and basil aroma with a medium-bitter flavor and a nice crisp, hoppy finish.  Solid.

Growler.  Clear, light golden color with a small white head.  Big resinous hop aroma.  Bunch of fruity pineapple notes, weed, touch of pine.  Amazing!  Taste is funky hops, slight BO, pine, grapefruit rind.  Really interesting, and quite good.  Maybe a bit too full bodied for me.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Updated rating: Bottle from Vons: Poured a solid gold that sparkled and fizzed with bubbles while a fat cap of foam head rested on top. Aroma is dominated by green oily hops that just ooze of acidic citrus like scents but not quite as fresh from the bottle as it was from the tap--must have had several weeks of shelf life. The same can be said for the flavor of the drink as it delivers a puckering bite of bitter hops but not as intense as I would have expected. Finish is clean and is easily quaffed down and I see why they listed "Session" on the bottle. 

1st rating November 19, 2011 On tap @ Toronado: Liquid poured clear sparkling golden ale with a thick frothy layer of foam head. Extremely bold aroma of citrus hops that are over the top with a funky scent of sweat or body odor but still keeps my interest. Huge bite of hops in the flavor along with notes of pine, grapefruit, coriander, and finishes with a metallic aftertaste. Good stuff.

(on draught at Alpine).  Pours a clear orange/copper color with white head.  Moderate carbonation.  Aroma has dank hops, citrus, resin, caramel malts.  Semi-sweet with sharp bitterness.  Medium bodied with an oily texture.  Sharp, bitter finish.  Good beer.

(Bottle) Pours light hazy golden with and large off-white head. The aroma holds boatloads of fresh, sweaty grapefruit up front with undertones of flowers, tropical fruit and pine. Malt brings white bread and toast. A fantastic, hop bright nose. A touch of phenols and dough in the background. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and tiny acidic. Citrus, pine, light resin and light fruits. Light toasted white bread. The mouthfeel is clean and soft with light carbonation. Lingering medium to heavily bitter grapefruit finish. Light to medium bodied.

(Growler thanks to jyoungsbcp) clear gold with creamy tan head and excellent lacing. Nose is floral, big huge citrus, onion, and cream. Taste of cream, a bit herbal, onion, grassy, crushed flowers, light herbal bitterness, potpourri, great creamy palate.

Tap @ PP Carlsbad.  Golden clear in the glass with a slight slick of white foam.  Aroma is clean and pungent floral hops, light citrus, pine, and subdued bitterness.  Clean and crisp feel in the mouth with floral hops up front followed by citrus and a clean bitterness over tight and dry  malt profile.  Excellent, sessionable hoppy beer.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2011 On tap at Pizza Port, Carlsbad 
Appearance: Clear golden with a medium sized white head and lots of lacing 
Aroma: Fruity and fresh citrus 
Taste: Tropical fruit and grapefruit 
Very enjoyable. I wasnt the only one, a fly dive bombed into it when I was half way through a pint. Scooped him out and kept enjoying it.

On tap at ABC 09.09.2011 with Andy, James and Dallas for Dallas bachelor weekend. Light amber pour with a light, airy, floral hoppiness to the nose. Delicate, balanced hoppiness on the palate. Great balance and overall extremely good. Best offering from Alpine on that day (that I tried).
Draft at Toronado with Andrew and James. Pours a clear amber with slight head. Nice big citrus nose. Flavor is appropriately juicy with lots of citrus hops and a peppery finish.
Draft at toronado with Andrew and dallas. Pours a slightly hazy amber with white lacing. Aroma is fresh, bitter pine hop. Mouthfeel is great with pine, lots of citrus, and some bitter notes.
On tap at tornado in san diego for Dallas birthday.  A more aggressive brew that really tastes like an ipa.

tap at the brewery-pours bright orange with a small soapy lovely crisp head.  nose is out of this world-dank tropical notes dry hopped to high hell.  WOW!  these flavors...lots of hops with quite a bit of husky notes as well.  dank fresh green hops.  WOW lots of cookie sugar malt, but not too sweet.  this has a little green onion on the finish, but it has lots of other hop flavors to not detract anything form the overall enjoyment of this beer.  This shit is off the chain!!!!  The dank notes of this beer are sick!  THE Best APA I have EVER Had!!!!
Pours a golden color with a nice head to it. Has a big tangerine smell to it. Has a piney hoppy taste with a slight citrus finish. Very solid.

Draft at toronado.  Clear golden light amber pour, with frothy white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is saturated with dank pine hops, grapefruit, and tropical fruit.  Similar flavor, super fresh, pine needles, mango, citrus, light caramel malt, grain, damn fresh.  Might be the best pale ale I have tried, dry and hoppy.  Delicious.

Draught at Toronadosd. Gold with a small white head. Big spicy, floral, dank, and citrus hop aroma backed by a touch of grainy malt. Dry flavor with a crackery malt component and some grassy hop bitterness. Light bodied. I dont know what it is here, but the malt/hop flavor combo doesnt seem to gel well compared to their other hoppy beers. Im all for lower-alcohol hop bombs, but this is oddly out of balance. Id like to give it another go with a newer batch.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2011 Growler Clear golden ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Excellent, fragile retention. The nose is big-time pink grapefruit with an underpinning of pine. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation. The flavor is of heavily bitter grapefruit rind and pine bark. Crisp, bitter, very dry finish. Growler courtesy of richiesd! Shared with Kevin, owner of Broken Barrel Tavern in Palm Bay, Florida to celebrate the second anniversary of his fine establishment.

On tap at the brewery. It pours orange with a nice white head. The aroma is hoppy with some citrus and florals. The flavor is the same with the Alpine signature blissfully unbalanced hop potency that really showcases the complexity of the leafy citrus qualities. The is a hint of bread in there. It has a very nice body.

Huge, huge, HUGE thanks to mday for this. After multiple unanswered ISOs, this gets delivered to my doorstep announced. Glad I got to experience at least part of your California trip.

Pours a moderate yellow-orange color with a white head and some pretty good lacing. Nose brings forward some really nice tropical, floral, and citrus notes. It seems like theyve crammed every single hop variety into this one and then balanced them all out perfectly. The taste is similar with some really well defined hop notes. I got the most out of the tropical hops, though Amyliz4 got more from others. This is just stupendously well done with a beautiful balance between bitterness and drinkability. This is probably the best APA that I have ever had. Thanks again, Mike--I really owe you one.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 11-03-2010

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2011 A fresh growler provided by Alex, drank from a Cigar City snifter... The body is a bright dark clear gold with a beautiful off-white head. The head rises a few fingers and settles with a nice cap, decent lacing. Crystal colors and contrast, looks great... The aroma is very sharp, at the most basic level its a mixture of catty/dank and sweet amarillo like hops. Other notes of pine and lemon, very good. Its sweet but dank... The taste isnt as sweet as the nose, more of steady hops throughout, not super bitter though. Light grapefruit on the front. This is an apa that tastes like an ipa but drinks like an apa. Has to be one of the most flavorful drinkable 5% beers out there. The aroma is outstanding, well worth trying.

I had this today on tap at Alpine Beer company outside of San Diego. It pours a light golden color with a medium white head and good carbonation, very attractive. Aromas are citrus! I think they used Citra hops for dry-hopping this and its evident. The taste is all citrus hops, nice and bitter. Excellent for a fairly low alcohol Pale Ale hop bomb.
From the tap poured an amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice light hoppy flavor with a lingering finish.

On tap at the brewery today.  Golden amber with the slightest haze.  Nose straight up hops.  Light and sweet-sharp.  Taste is mid cotrus hops to sharper hop back.  Good middle of the palate IPA.  Bit of citrus in the hops.  Nice.

Growler. Big thanks to alex for sharing... Pours a golden cidery, mostly transparent hue with a thin to medium soapy white head quickly reducing to a thin flimsy film... Dank fresh potent hops upfront while simultaneously combining with tangerine, lemony, and a general citrusy profile. Somewhat sweet through the middle but overly so. Awesome... Flavors dont sway too far from the nose which is completely fantastic. Dank, fresh and crisp with very assertive yet so drinkable. Carbonation and light to medium bodied. Wow this hits the spot in all aspects.

Slightly disappointing. Pours lightly hazy, golden yellow with a big white head, spider web lace. Smells lightly citrusy hoppy with a moderate, sweet malt backbone backing it up. Tastes the same. Light, somewhat bright, hop flavors. Sweet with some citrus, light bitterness. Sweet malt backbone. Light body, good carbonation.

On tap @ Alpine. Golden yellow with a small head. Aroma of tropical fruit, flowers and some light malt aromas. The flavor is dry bitterness on top of a lightly sweet malt base. Medium to light body with average carbonation and a dry bitter finish. Another excellent IPA from Alpine.

Tap at Toronado SD a couple weeks ago.  Pours a medium golden-yellow color with one finger of white foam.  The aroma is very hoppy, basically a pine and spruce forest with sharp pine needles and a going-shopping-for-a-Christmas-tree smell.  There are lighter notes of flowers, herbs, skunk, and cat piss.  Like I said, a very hoppy aroma.  Flavor is also full of earthy sticky hops with lots of pine and sharp grapefruit.  Though big on hop aroma and flavor, this is not overly bitter.  I am surprised that the ABV is this low considering how otherwise big this beer is, though it could probably use a slightly stronger malt backbone.  Alpine are the hop perfectionists, and Hoppy Birthday is no exception.  (21, 421)

on tap at toronado SD. pours a clear, light gold with a thin, white head and tight rings of sticky lace. aroma is great with huge fruity notes of peaches, sweet, dried apricots, and tangerine citrus with notes of fresh cut grass, pine esters, and light, toasted malts. flavor is delicious as well with big, fruity hop notes of tangerine and pink grapefruit with light tropical fruits and hints of sweet, green grapes backed by dry, dusty, toasted, caramel malts. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a dry, bitter finish. overall, a great sessionable ipa.
Clear golden pour with white head. Aroma is hoppy and taste is sweet and floral with slight bitterness. Too easy to drink.
Clear yellow with a fizzy white head. Big huge citrus and pine aroma and taste with a woody bitterness and a thick palate.

8/16/10 notes: on tap, Blue Palms.  A solid all-around clean IPA.  Aroma had tropical elements, grapefruit, flowers.  Palate is crisp and on the lighter side, which I greatly prefer for IPAs.  Hops of clear display here.  Finishes with solid bitterness, good floral character.
I had this on draft at the Blue Palms Second Anniversary Party.  This clear yellow-gold pour is tropical hoppy and very dry.

On tap. Pours with a clear golden body and a large white head. Aroma is huge, amarilloish tropical fruit, caramel, and good all the way around. Taste is fruity, mildly bitter finish, mango, nectarine and dry. Lively bubbles, well attenuated.

A: The pour is a slightly hazy golden color with a drop of orange for a little variety. A nice fluffy white head and solid lacing.

S: This is what you expect from an Alpine beer: tons and tons of hops. Lots of grapefruit and some tropical fruit notes along with plenty of pine, too. If theres a malt scent in there, I couldnt find it.

T: The hops continue to dominate on the palate. A very nice resinous bitterness along with tons of fruit character. Grapefruit, lemon, pineapple, and lots of pine.

M: The body is a bit on the light side, but this works just fine for a pale ale. A good amount of carbonation, and a real crisp finish.

D: This is one of my new Alpine favorites. So brutally hoppy, but so easy to drink (helped along by a moderate ABV).

Not sure if its the water integrity or otherwise, but the consistency seems to almost chafe the tongue with a granite-like mouthfeel. The flavor is indicative of its title, however, and douses the taste-buds with obligatory hoppiness. The low APV pulls the leash back on this beer from having a ferocious bite, but its still decent enough. The aftertaste feels like youve been gargling sand from the Sahara desert, which is probably not the desired effect. Scent is that of spruce trees in a high-wind. Adequate, but not overwhelmingly fantastic.

Draft:  nose is vividly piney and minty, retardedly fresh smelling, but again, fuckin piney like snorting an 8 ball of christmas.  Pretty transparent and light in color.  Head didnt really have room to exist in the pint glass.  Did I mention I hate pint glasses? Fucking stupid pieces of shit!  Flavors were full on pine...in a very nice vivid way.  This is fucking christmas tree beer right here and as fresh an ipa can be.   Though the body is just medium, it somehow has a syrupy nature to it, but regardless...this is like drinking pureed christmas trees, if that tasted like ipa.

Growler courtesy of stefanje after RBSG. Thanks! Pours a clear pale amber color with a large frothy white head. Decent head retention and nice lacing. Aroma of citrus hops, including grapefruit, pineapple and candied citrus and some tropical notes. Some faint caramel malts as well. The taste is bitter earthy hops with some resin and citrus notes. Pale malts in the background. Medium bodied. Nice, drinkable IPA.
On tap at Toronado SD. Pours crystal clear, aroma of sticky hops and pine. Flavor is nice, but not enough bitterness to balance the considerable sweetness.
Tap at hamms, pours golden with a bright white head.  Nose is sweet and lightly hopped. Taste is sweet hoppy with a great citrus pine bite.  Nice

On tap at  OBriens:  Pale golden color with a small off-white head. Aroma has lots of citrus/grapefruity hops. Light fruity/caramel sweet start followed by some light grassiness and citrus with a long dry grapefruit bitter finish. Light-medium body is crisp and tangy with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Great tropical fruit flavors in this one, sweet melons dominate the palate and the bitterness is very mild for a beer with this much flavor and such a muted malt profile.  Really, really good stuff.

4oz(I think) taster at the brewery. Pours a dark yellow gold color with a medium white head. The aroma is overtly hoppy with fresh green hops, grass and something floral. The taste is similar with lots of fresh green hops in a biscuit malt base. The palate is full and smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes dry and clean. Overall: I love the taste of fresh green chlorophyll hops, I know many people consider this a defect, but to hell with them. This is good beer.

A damn fine beer, I would drink it until my liver gave way. Nothing offensive at all, just beer bliss. Would get again fo sho. Huge hop aroma, slightly sweet and grainy body, moderate bitterness, light on the palate, VERY drinkable. amazing pale ale.

Fresh growler shared by largadeer on BA.

Pours clear copper with a great lacey white head.  Looks incredible.

Aroma is typical amazing Alpine: citrusy, floral, and herbal hops, as well as just a hint of sweet malt.

Flavor is amazing for a pale ale (or really more of an IPA).  Citrusy - tangerine and grapefruit - with an excellent tropical fruit note and some herbal qualities.  Just a little sweet malt in the background.

Medium-bodied with great hop resins.

Overall, just incredible.  This is what every pale ale should aspire to.  I could session the hell out of this.

Growler from Alpine Beer Co. poured into 16oz pint glass. Pours golden yellow with medium white head, the beer is crystal clear. Aroma is of beautiful hops, pine and citrus that resinate in the nose. Mouth feel was smooth with excellent carbonation. Taste is of the same beautiful hops found in the aroma. Excellent beer, you would not think its 5% from the taste as the flavor is very extreme, great session brew.

On tap at Toronado on Friday night.  Bright golden color and nice white head. Grassy and citrus nose. Huge blast of tasty bitter hops with a great medium palate presence. Long bitter finish leaning on the dry side. Killer beer.
Tap @ Toronado. Pours a mostly clear gold with a small off white head, light lacing. Nose of sticky pine needles and faint toasted malts. Fairly sticky and bitter on the palate.
